entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is mentioned as someone who knows what Muriel told Harry. She is also shown to be concerned about Harry's feelings and wants him to get the truth.

entities.name: muriel
entities.description: Muriel is introduced as a malicious old woman who has told Harry something that upset him. Hermione questions Harry's decision to believe Muriel.

entities.name: rita skeeter
entities.description: Rita Skeeter is mentioned by Hermione as someone who writes malicious articles about people. Hermione suggests that Harry should not believe her.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned by Hermione as someone whom Harry knew and trusted. She suggests that Harry's memories of Dumbledore are being tarnished by the lies of others.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character in this passage. He is upset by what Muriel told him and wants to know the truth.

relationships.description: Hermione is concerned about Harry's feelings and wants him to get the truth.
Hermione suggests that Rita Skeeter writes malicious articles about people, implying that she cannot be trusted by Harry.
Muriel told Harry something that upset him. Hermione questions Harry's decision to believe Muriel.
Hermione mentions Dumbledore as someone whom Harry knew and trusted.
